text: (1) No publication and broadcasting or dissemination No radio, television, on-line or other form of digital or electronic equipment, press or other means of communication publishing, broadcasting or printing any news item, feature, editorial, article, information or other material shall be closed or seized nor shall registration thereof be cancelled nor shall such material be seized by the reason of publication, broadcasting or printing of such material through any audio, audio-visual or electronic equipment. Provided that nothing contained in this clause shall be deemed to prevent the making of an Act to regulate radio, television, online or any other form of digital or electronic equipment, press or other means of communication.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to communication:
text: (1) No publication and broadcasting or dissemination No means of communication including the press, electronic broadcasting and telephone shall be interrupted except in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without informing him or her of the ground for his or her arrest.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without Any person who is arrested shall have the right to consult a legal practitioner of his or her choice from the time of such arrest and to be defended by such legal practitioner. Any consultation made by such person with, and advice given by, his or her legal practitioner shall be confidential. Provided this clause shall not apply to a citizen of an enemy state. Explanation: For the purpose of this clause, "legal practitioner" means any person who is authorized by law to represent any person in any court.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without Any person who is arrested shall be produced before the adjudicating authority within a period of twenty-four hours of such arrest, excluding the time necessary for the journey from the place of arrest to such authority; and any such person shall not be detained in custody except on the order of such authority. Provided that this clause shall not apply to a person held in preventive detention and to a citizen of an enemy state.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without No person shall be liable for punishment for an act which was not punishable by the law in force when the act was committed nor shall any person be subjected to a punishment greater than that prescribed by the law in force at the time of the commission of the offence.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without Every person charged with an offence shall be presumed innocent until proved guilty of the offence.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without No person shall be tried and punished for the same offence in a court more than once.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without No person charged with an offence shall be compelled to testify against himself or herself.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without Every person shall have the right to be informed of any proceedings taken against him or her.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without Every person shall have the right to a fair trial by an independent, impartial and competent court or judicial body.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights relating to justice:
text: (1) No person shall be detained in custody without Any indigent party shall have the right to free legal aid in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right of victim of crime:
text: (1) A victim of crime shall have the right to get information about the investigation and proceedings of a case in which he or she is the victim.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right of victim of crime:
text: (1) A victim of crime shall have the right to get A victim of crime shall have the right to justice including social rehabilitation and compensation in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against torture:
text: (1) No person who is arrested or detained shall be subjected to physical or mental torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against torture:
text: (1) No person who is arrested or detained shall be Any act mentioned in clause (1) shall be punishable by law, and any person who is the victim of such treatment shall have the right to obtain compensation in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against preventive detention:
text: (1) No person shall be held under preventive detention unless there is a sufficient ground of the existence of an immediate threat to the sovereignty, territorial integrity or public peace and order of Nepal.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against preventive detention:
text: (1) No person shall be held under Information about the situation of a person who is held under preventive detention pursuant to clause (1) must be given immediately to his or her family members or relatives. Provided that this clause shall not apply to a citizen of an enemy state.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against preventive detention:
text: (1) No person shall be held under If the authority making preventive detention holds any person under preventive detention contrary to law or in bad faith, the person held under preventive detention shall have the right to obtain compensation in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against untouchability and discrimination:
text: (1) No person shall be subjected to any form of untouchability or discrimination in any private and public places on grounds of his or her origin, caste, tribe, community, profession, occupation or physical condition.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against untouchability and discrimination:
text: (1) No person shall be In producing or distributing any goods, services or facilities, no person belonging to any particular caste or tribe shall be prevented from purchasing or acquiring such goods, services or facilities nor shall such goods, services or facilities be sold, distributed or provided only to the persons belonging to any particular caste or tribe.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against untouchability and discrimination:
text: (1) No person shall be No act purporting to demonstrate any person or community as superior or inferior on grounds of origin, caste, tribe or physical condition or justifying social discrimination on grounds of caste, tribe or untouchability or propagating ideology based on untouchability and caste based superiority or hatred or encouraging caste-based discrimination in any manner whatsoever shall be allowed.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against untouchability and discrimination:
text: (1) No person shall be No discrimination in any form shall be allowed at a workplace with or without making untouchability on the ground of caste.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against untouchability and discrimination:
text: (1) No person shall be Any act of untouchability and discrimination in any form committed in contravention of this Article shall be punishable by law as a severe social offence, and the victim of such act shall have the right to obtain compensation in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to property:
text: (1) Every citizen shall, subject to law, have the right to acquire, own, sell, dispose, acquire business profits from, and otherwise deal with, property. Provided that the State may levy tax on property of a person, and tax on income of a person in accordance with the concept of progressive taxation. Explanation: For the purposes of this Article, "property" means any form of property including movable and immovable property, and includes an intellectual property right.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to property:
text: (1) Every citizen shall, subject to law, have the right The State shall not, except for public interest, requisition, acquire, or otherwise create any encumbrance on, property of a person. Provided that this clause shall not apply to any property acquired by any person illicitly.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to property:
text: (1) Every citizen shall, subject to law, have the right The basis of compensation to be provided and procedures to be followed in the requisition by the State of property of any person for public interest in accordance with clause (3) shall be as provided for in the Act.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to property:
text: (1) Every citizen shall, subject to law, have the right The provisions of clauses (2) and (3) shall not prevent the State from making land reforms, management and regulation in accordance with law for the purposes of enhancement of product and productivity of lands, modernization and commercialization of agriculture, environment protection and planned housing and urban development.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to property:
text: (1) Every citizen shall, subject to law, have the right Nothing shall prevent the State from using the property of any person, which it has requisitioned for public interest in accordance with clause
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to property:
text: (1) Every citizen shall, subject to law, have the right , for any other public interest instead of such public interest.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to freedom of religion:
text: (1) Every person who has faith in religion shall have the freedom to profess, practice and protect his or her religion according to his or her conviction.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to freedom of religion:
text: (1) Every person who has faith in religion shall Every religious denomination shall have the right to operate and protect its religious sites and religious Guthi (trusts). Provided that nothing shall be deemed to prevent the regulation, by making law, of the operation and protection of religious sites and religious trusts and management of trust properties and lands.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to freedom of religion:
text: (1) Every person who has faith in religion shall No person shall, in the exercise of the right conferred by this Article, do, or cause to be done, any act which may be contrary to public health, decency and morality or breach public peace, or convert another person from one religion to another or any act or conduct that may jeopardize other's religion.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to information: Every citizen shall have the right to demand and receive
text: information on any matter of his or her interest or of public interest. Provided that no one shall be compelled to provide information on any matter of which confidentiality must be maintained in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to privacy: The privacy of any person, his or her residence, property,
text: document, data, correspondence and matters relating to his or her character shall, except in accordance with law, be inviolable.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against exploitation:
text: (1) Every person shall have the right against exploitation.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against exploitation:
text: (1) Every person shall have the right against No person shall be exploited in any manner on the grounds of religion, custom, tradition, usage, practice or on any other grounds.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against exploitation:
text: (1) Every person shall have the right against No one shall be subjected to trafficking nor shall one be held in slavery or servitude.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against exploitation:
text: (1) Every person shall have the right against No one shall be forced to work against his or her will. Provided that nothing shall be deemed to prevent the making of law empowering the State to require citizens to perform compulsory service for public purposes.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right against exploitation:
text: (1) Every person shall have the right against Act contrary to clauses (3) and (4) shall be punishable by law and the victim shall have the right to obtain compensation from the perpetrator in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to clean environment:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right to live in a clean and healthy environment.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to clean environment:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right to live in a The victim shall have the right to obtain compensation, in accordance with law, for any injury caused from environmental pollution or degradation.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to clean environment:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right to live in a This Article shall not be deemed to prevent the making of necessary legal provisions for a proper balance between the environment and development, in development works of the nation.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to education:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right of access to basic education.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to education:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right of access to Every citizen shall have the right to get compulsory and free education up to the basic level and free education up to the secondary level from the State.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to education:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right of access to The citizens with disabilities and the economically indigent citizens shall have the right to get free higher education in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to education:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right of access to The visually impaired citizens shall have the right to get free education through brail script and the citizens with hearing or speaking impairment, to get free education through sign language, in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to education:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right of access to Every Nepalese community residing in Nepal shall have the right to get education in its mother tongue and, for that purpose, to open and operate schools and educational institutes, in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to language and culture:
text: (1) Every person and community shall have the right to use their languages.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to language and culture:
text: (1) Every person and community shall have the Every person and community shall have the right to participate in the cultural life of their communities.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to language and culture:
text: (1) Every person and community shall have the Every Nepalese community residing in Nepal shall have the right to preserve and promote its language, script, culture, cultural civilization and heritage.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to employment:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right to employment. The terms and conditions of employment, and unemployment benefit shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to employment:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right to employment. Every citizen shall have the right to choose employment.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to labour:
text: (1) Every labourer shall have the right to practice appropriate labour. Explanation: For the purposes of this Article, "labourer" means a labourer or worker who does physical or mental work for an employer in consideration for remuneration.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to labour:
text: (1) Every labourer shall have the right to practice appropriate Every labourer shall have the right to appropriate remuneration, facilities and contributory social security.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to labour:
text: (1) Every labourer shall have the right to practice appropriate Every labourer shall have the right to form and join trade unions and to engage in collective bargaining, in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to health:
text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right to free basic health services from the State, and no one shall be deprived of emergency health services.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right relating to health:

text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right relating to food. Every citizen shall have the right to be safe from the state of being in danger of life from the scarcity of food.

text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right relating to food. Every citizen shall have the right to food sovereignty in accordance with law.

text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right to an appropriate housing.

text: (1) Every citizen shall have the right to an appropriate No citizen shall be evicted from the residence owned by him or her nor shall his or her residence be infringed except in accordance with law.

text: (1) Every woman shall have equal lineage right without gender based discrimination.

text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth registration along with his or her identity.

text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth Every child shall have the right to elementary child development and child participation.

text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth No child shall be employed to work in any factory, mine or engaged in similar other hazardous work.

text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth No child shall be subjected to child marriage, transported illegally, abducted/kidnapped or taken in hostage.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of the child:
text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth No child shall be recruited or used in army, police or any armed group, or be subjected, in the name of cultural or religious traditions, to abuse, exclusion or physical, mental, sexual or other form of exploitation or improper use by any means or in any manner.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of the child:
text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth No child shall be subjected to physical, mental or any other form of torture in home, school or other place and situation whatsoever.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of the child:
text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth Every child shall have the right to juvenile friendly justice.

section_title: Rights of the child:
text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth The child who is helpless, orphan, with disabilities, conflict victim, displaced or vulnerable shall have the right to special protection and facilities from the State.

section_title: Rights of the child:
text: (1) Every child shall have the right to name and birth Any act contrary to in clauses (4), (5), (6) and (7) shall be punishable by law, and a child who is the victim of such act shall have the right to obtain compensation from the perpetrator, in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of Dalit:
text: (1) The Dalit shall have the right to participate in all bodies of the State on the basis of the principle of proportional inclusion. Special provision shall be made by law for the empowerment, representation and participation of the Dalit community in public services as well as other sectors of employment.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of Dalit:
text: (1) The Dalit shall have the right to participate in all bodies of Provision of free education with scholarship, from primary to higher education, shall be made by law for the Dalit students. Special provision shall be made by law for the Dalit in technical and vocational education.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of Dalit:
text: (1) The Dalit shall have the right to participate in all bodies of Special provision shall be made by law in order to provide health and social security to the Dalit community.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of Dalit:
text: (1) The Dalit shall have the right to participate in all bodies of The Dalit community shall have the right to use, protect and develop their traditional occupation, knowledge, skill and technology. The State shall accord priority to the Dalit community in modern business related with their traditional occupation and provide skills and resources required therefor.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of Dalit:
text: (1) The Dalit shall have the right to participate in all bodies of The State shall once provide land to the landless Dalit in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of Dalit:
text: (1) The Dalit shall have the right to participate in all bodies of The State shall, in accordance with law, arrange settlement for the Dalit who do not have housing.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of Dalit:
text: (1) The Dalit shall have the right to participate in all bodies of The facilities conferred by this Article to the Dalit community must be distributed in a just manner so that the Dalit women, men and Dalit in all communities can obtain such facilities proportionately.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of senior citizens: The senior citizens shall have the right to special
text: protection and social security from the State.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to social justice:
text: (1) The socially backward women, Dalit, indigenous people, indigenous nationalities, Madhesi, Tharu, minorities, persons with disabilities, marginalized communities, Muslims, backward classes, gender and sexual minorities, youths, farmers, labourers, oppressed or citizens of backward regions and indigent Khas Arya shall have the right to participate in the State bodies on the basis of inclusive principle.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to social justice:
text: (1) The socially backward women, Dalit, indigenous The indigent citizens and citizens of the communities on the verge of extinction shall have the right to get special opportunities and benefits in education, health, housing, employment, food and social security for their protection, upliftment, empowerment and development.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to social justice:
text: (1) The socially backward women, Dalit, indigenous The citizens with disabilities shall have the right to live with dignity and honour, with the identity of their diversity, and have equal access to public services and facilities.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to social justice:
text: (1) The socially backward women, Dalit, indigenous Every farmer shall have the right to have access to lands for agro activities, select and protect local seeds and agro species which have been used and pursued traditionally, in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to social justice:
text: (1) The socially backward women, Dalit, indigenous The families of the martyrs who have sacrificed their life, persons who were forced to disappear, and those who became disabled and injured in all popular movements, armed conflicts and revolutions that have been carried out for progressive democratic changes in Nepal, democracy fighters, conflict victims and displaced ones, persons with disabilities, the injured and victims shall have the right to get a  prioritized opportunity, with justice and due respect, in education, health, employment, housing and social security, in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to social security: The indigent citizens, incapacitated and helpless
text: citizens, helpless single women, citizens with disabilities, children, citizens who cannot take care themselves and citizens belonging to the tribes on the verge of extinction shall have the right to social security, in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of the consumer:
text: (1) Every consumer shall have the right to obtain quality goods and services.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Rights of the consumer:
text: (1) Every consumer shall have the right to obtain A person who has suffered injury from any substandard goods or services shall have the right to obtain compensation in accordance with law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Right to constitutional remedies: There shall be a right to obtain constitutional
text: remedies in the manner set forth in Article 133 or 144 for the enforcement of the rights conferred by this Part.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Implementation of fundamental rights: The State shall, as required, make legal
text: provisions for the implementation of the rights conferred by this Part, within three years of the commencement of this Constitution.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Duties of citizens: Every citizen shall have the following duties
text: (a) to safeguard the nationality, sovereignty and integrity of Nepal, while being loyal to the nation, (b) to abide by the Constitution and law, (c) to render compulsory service as and when the State so requires, (d) to protect and preserve public property.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: To be guiding principles:
text: (1) The directive principles, policies and obligations set forth in this Part shall be the guiding principles for the governance of the State.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: To be guiding principles:
text: (1) The directive principles, policies and obligations The State shall mobilize, or cause to be mobilized, means and resources, as required, to implement the principles, policies and obligations set forth in this Part.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Directive principles:
text: (1) The political objective of the State shall be to establish a public welfare system of governance, by establishing a just system in all aspects of the national life through the rule of law, values and norms of fundamental rights and human rights, gender equality, proportional inclusion, participation and social justice, while at the same time protecting the life, property, equality and liberties of the people, in keeping with the vitality of freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence of Nepal, and to consolidate a federal democratic republican system of governance in order to ensure an atmosphere conducive to the enjoyment of the fruits of democracy, while at the same time maintaining the relations between the Federal Units on the basis of cooperative federalism and incorporating the principle of proportional participation in the system of governance on the basis of local autonomy and decentralization.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Directive principles:
text: (1) The political objective of the State shall be to establish The social and cultural objective of the State shall be to build a civilized and egalitarian society by eliminating all forms of discrimination, exploitation and injustice on the grounds of religion, culture, tradition, usage, custom, practice or on any other similar grounds, to develop social, cultural values founded on national pride, democracy, pro-people, respect of labour, entrepreneurship, discipline, dignity and harmony, and to consolidate the national unity by maintaining social cohesion, solidarity and harmony, while recognizing cultural diversity.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Directive principles:
text: (1) The political objective of the State shall be to establish The economic objective of the State shall be to achieve a sustainable economic development, while achieving rapid economic growth, by way of maximum mobilization of the available means and resources through participation and development of public, private and cooperatives, and to develop a socialism-oriented independent and prosperous economy while making the national economy independent, self-reliant and progressive in order to  build an exploitation free society by abolishing economic inequality through equitable distribution of the gains.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Directive principles:
text: (1) The political objective of the State shall be to establish The State shall direct its international relations towards enhancing the dignity of the nation in the world community by maintaining international relations on the basis of sovereign equality, while safeguarding the freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence and national interest of Nepal.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: (a) Policies relating to national unity and national security:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to keep intact the national unity, while protecting the freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence of Nepal,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to promote the national unity while developing mutual cooperative relations between the Federal Units by maintaining mutual cohesion, harmony and solidarity between various castes, tribes, religions, languages, cultures and communities,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to maintain law and order by developing a national security system,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to guarantee  the overall human security system,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make all security organs, including the Nepal Army, Nepal Police and Armed Police Force Nepal, competent, strong, professional, inclusive and accountable to the people, on the basis of national security policies,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make and keep the citizens ready and competent to serve the nation as and when necessary,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make proper use, in nations' interest, of the knowledge, skills and experiences of former public employees including former employees, military and police. (b) Policies relating to political and governance system of State:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to guarantee the best interests and prosperity of the people through economic, social and cultural transformations, while safeguarding, consolidating and developing political achievements,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to maintain rule of law by protecting and promoting human rights,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to implement international treaties, agreements to which Nepal is a party,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to guarantee good governance by ensuring the equal and easy access of the people to the services and facilities delivered by the State, while making public administration fair, competent, impartial, transparent, free from corruption, accountable and participatory,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make necessary provisions to make mass media fair, healthy, impartial, decent, responsible and professional,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to develop and expand harmonious and cooperative relations between the Federal Units by way of sharing of responsibilities, resources and administration between them. (c) Relating to social and cultural transformation:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to build the society founded on cordial social relations by developing a healthy and civilized culture,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to carrying out studies, research works, excavation and dissemination for the protection, promotion and development of ancient, archaeological and cultural heritages,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make community development through enhancement of local public participation, by promoting and mobilizing the creativity of local communities in social, cultural and service-oriented works,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to focus on the development of arts, literature and music which form cultural heritages,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to end all forms of discrimination, inequality, exploitation and injustice in the name of religion, custom, usage, practice and tradition existing in the society,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to protect and develop languages, scripts, culture, literature, arts, motion pictures and heritages of various castes, tribes, and communities on the basis of equality and co-existence, while maintaining the cultural diversity of the country,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to pursue a multi-lingual policy. (d) Relating to economy, industry and commerce:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to enhance national economy through partnership and independent development of the public, private and cooperative sectors,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to achieve economic prosperity by way of optimum mobilization of the available means and resources, while focusing on the role of private sector in economy,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to promote the cooperative sector and mobilize it in national development to the maximum extent,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to encourage and mobilize the economic sector in the overall national development, while providing for regulation to maintain fairness, accountability and competition in all of its activities,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make equitable distribution of the available means and resources and benefits of economic development,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to diversify and expand markets for goods and services, while promoting exports through development and expansion of industries upon identifying areas of comparative advantage,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to protect the interests of consumers by maintaining trade fairness and discipline by making national economy competitive, while ending activities such as creating black marketing, monopoly, artificial scarcity and restricting competition,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to protect and promote domestic industries and resources and accord priority to domestic investment based on Nepalese labour, skills and raw materials for the development of national economy,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to give priority to domestic investment for the development of national economy,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to encourage foreign capital and technological investment in areas of import substitution and export promotion, in consonance with national interest, and encourage and mobilize such investment in infrastructure building,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make the obtaining of foreign assistance transparent, while making the national needs and priorities as the basis for obtaining foreign assistance, and incorporating amounts received in form of foreign assistance in the national budget,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to utilize knowledge, skill, technology and capital of the nonresident Nepalese in the national development,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to give dynamism to the economic development by establishing coordination between the States and the States and the Federation in relation to industrial corridors, special economic zones, national projects and projects involving foreign investment. (e) Policies relating to agriculture and land reforms:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make scientific land reforms having regard to the interests of the farmers, while ending the dual ownership existing in the lands,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to enhance product and productivity by carrying out land pooling, while discouraging inactive land ownership,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make land management and commercialization, industrialization, diversification and modernization of agriculture, by pursuing land-use policies to enhance agriculture product and productivity, while protecting and promoting the rights and interests of the farmers,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make proper use of lands, while regulating and managing lands on the basis of, inter alia, productivity, nature of lands and ecological balance,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to provide for the farmers' access to agricultural inputs, agroproducts at fair price and market. (f) Policies relating to development:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to formulate sustainable socio-economic development strategies and programs under the regional development plan for inclusive economic development with regional balance, and implement them in a coordinative manner,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to develop balanced, environment friendly, quality and sustainable physical infrastructures, while according priority to the regions lagging behind from development perspective,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to enhance local public participation in the process of development works,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to enhance investment in scientific study, research works and in invention, progress and development of science and technology, and protect scientists, technologists, intellectual and eminent talents,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to ensure easy and simple access of the general public to information technology by developing and expanding information technology to the tune of national needs, and make optimum utilization of information technology in the national development,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make provisions enabling the general public to enjoy fruits of development in a just manner, while according priority to the indigent citizens in the distribution of such fruits,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to develop an integrated national identity management information system and manage all kinds of information and data of the citizens in an integrated manner, and linking such system with the services and facilities provided by the State and with national development plans,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to update demographic statistics and linking it with national development plans. (g) Policies relating to protection, promotion and use of natural resources:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to protect, promote, and make environmental friendly and sustainable use  of, natural resources available in the country, in consonance with national interest and adopting the concept of inter-generational equity, and make equitable distribution of fruits, according priority and preferential right to the local communities,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make multi-purpose development of water resources, while according priority to domestic investment based on public participation,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to ensure reliable supply of energy in an affordable and easy manner, and make proper use of energy, for the fulfilment of the basic needs of citizens, by generating and developing renewable energy,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to develop sustainable and reliable irrigation by making control of water-induced disasters, and river management,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to conserve, promote, and make sustainable use of, forests, wildlife, birds, vegetation and bio-diversity, by mitigating possible risks to environment from industrial and physical development, while raising awareness of general public about environment cleanliness,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to maintain the forest area in necessary lands for ecological balance,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to adopt appropriate measures to abolish or mitigate existing or possible adverse environmental impacts on the nature, environment or biological diversity,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to pursue the principles of environmentally sustainable development such as the principles of polluter pays, of precaution in environmental protection and of prior informed consent.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make advance warning, preparedness, rescue, relief and rehabilitation in order to mitigate risks from natural disasters. (h) Policies relating to basic needs of the citizens:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to prepare human resources that are competent, competitive, ethical, and devoted to national interests, while making education scientific, technical, vocational, empirical, employment and people-oriented,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make private sector investment made in education serviceoriented by regulating and managing such investment, while enhancing the State's investment in the education sector,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make higher education easy, qualitative and accessible, and free gradually,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to establish and promote community information centres and libraries for the personality development of citizens,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to keep on enhancing investment necessary in the  public health sector by the State in order to make the citizens healthy,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to ensure easy, convenient and equal access of all to quality health services,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to protect and promote health systems including Ayurveda, as a traditional medical system of Nepal, natural therapy and homeopathy system,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make private sector investment in the health sector serviceoriented by regulating and managing such investment, while enhancing the State's investment in this sector,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to focus on health research and keep on increasing the number of health institutions and health workers in order to make health services widely available and qualitative,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to increase average life expectancy by reducing maternal and infant mortality rate, while encouraging family planning for population management on the basis of Nepal's capacity and need,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to manage unplanned settlement and develop planned and systematic settlement,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to provide for sustainable production, supplies, storage, security, and easy and effective distribution of foods by encouraging food production in tune with climate and soil, in consonance with the concept of food sovereignty, while enhancing investment in the agriculture sector,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to ensure planned supply system by according special priority to the remote and backward regions, while ensuring equal access of all citizens to basic goods and services,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to enhance investment in the transportation sector, while ensuring simple, easy and equal access of the citizens to transportation facilities, and to make the transportation sector safe, systematic and persons with disabilities friendly by encouraging public transportation and regulating private transportation, while according priority to the environment friendly technologies,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to arrange for access to medical treatment while ensuring citizen's health insurance. (i) Policies relating to labour and employment:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make competent and professional the labour force that has remained as the main socio-economic strength of the country and enhance employment within the country, while ensuring a situation enabling all to work,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to guarantee social security, while ensuring the basic rights of all labours, in consonance with the concept of decent labour,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to abolish all forms of labour exploitation including child labour,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to encourage participation of labours in management, while maintain cordial relations between the labours and entrepreneurs,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to regulate and manage the sector in order to make foreign employment free from exploitation, safe and systematic and to guarantee employment and rights of the labours,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to encourage to mobilize the capital, skills, technology and experience gained from foreign employment in productive sectors in the country. (j) Policies relating to social justice and inclusion:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to keep on making appropriate arrangements for the livelihoods of the helpless single women, while according priority to them in employment on the basis of skills, competency and qualification,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make self-dependent the women who are vulnerable, subjected to social and family exclusion and victims of violence self-reliant by making their rehabilitation, protection and empowerment,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to ensure enjoyment of requisite services and facilities at the reproductive stage,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to evaluate economically the work and contribution such as maintenance of children and care of families,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to take into consideration primarily of the best interests of the child,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to identify the freed bonded labours, Kamlari, Harawa, Charawa, tillers, landless, squatters and rehabilitate them by providing housing, housing plot for residence and cultivable land or employment for their livelihoods,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to create an atmosphere conducive to the full enjoyment of the political, economic, social and cultural rights, while enhancing the participation of youths in national development, to make their personality development, while providing special opportunity in areas including education, health and employment for the empowerment and development of the youths and provide them with appropriate opportunities for the overall development of the State,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make the indigenous nationalities participate in decisions concerning that community by making special provisions for opportunities and benefits in order to ensure the right of these nationalities to live with dignity, along with their identity, and protect and promote traditional knowledge, skill, culture, social tradition and experience of the indigenous nationalities and local communities,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make special provisions for opportunities and benefits to minority communities to enjoy social and cultural rights, with maintaining their identity,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make special provisions for equal distribution of economic, social and cultural opportunities and benefits to the Madhesi community, Muslims and backward class, and for opportunities and benefits to the indigent citizens within such communities for their protection, upliftment, empowerment and development,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make special provisions for opportunities and benefits for the protection, upliftment, empowerment and development of the citizens of the oppressed and backward regions and for the fulfilment of their basic needs,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to accord priority to the indigent within all sexes, regions and communities in the provision of social security and social justice,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make planned investment in sports and sport-persons in order to prepare healthy, competent and disciplined citizens, and to develop sports as a means of consolidating national unity and enhancing national prestige at the international level,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to adopt a single door system for the establishment, approval, operation, regulation and management of community-based and national or international non-governmental organizations and to involve such organizations only in the sectors of national need and priority, while making investment and role of such organizations transparent and accountable. (k) Policies relating to justice and penal system:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to make the administration of justice speedy, efficient, widely available, economical, impartial, effective, and accountable to people,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to pursue alternative means such as mediation and arbitration for the settlement of disputes of general nature,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to adopt effective measures for the control of corruption and irregularities in all sectors including political, administrative, judicial and social sectors. (l) Policies relating to tourism: To develop eco-friendly tourism industries as an important base of national economy by way of identification, protection, promotion and publicity of the ancient, cultural, religious, archaeological and natural heritages of Nepal, to make environment and policy required for the development of tourism culture, and to accord priority to local people in the distribution of benefits of tourism industries. (m) Policies relating to international relations:
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to conduct an independent  foreign policy based on the Charter of the United Nations, non-alignment, principles of Panchsheel, international law and the norms of world peace, taking into consideration of the overall interest of  the nation, while remaining active in safeguarding the sovereignty, territorial integrity, independence and national interest of Nepal,
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Policies of the State: The State shall pursue the following policies
text: to review treaties concluded in the past, and make treaties, agreements based on equality and mutual interest.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Obligations of the State: It shall be the obligation of the State to make Nepal a
text: prosperous and affluent country by  protecting and promoting fundamental rights and human rights, pursuing directive principles of the State and gradually implementing policies of the State, while keeping intact the freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity and independence of Nepal.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: To submit report: The Government of Nepal shall submit an annual report
text: containing the steps taken and achievements made in the implementation of the directive principles, policies and obligations of the State set forth in this Part to the President, and the President shall cause such report to be laid through the Prime Minister before the Federal Parliament.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Provisions relating to monitoring: There shall be a committee, in accordance
text: with law, in the Federal Parliament in order to monitor and evaluate whether the directive principles, policies and obligations of the State set forth in this Part have been implemented progressively or not.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Questions not to be raised in court: No question shall be raised in any court as
text: to whether any matter contained in this Part has been implemented or not.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Structure of State:
text: (1) The main structure of the Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal shall be of three levels, namely the Federation, the State and the Local level.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Structure of State:
text: (1) The main structure of the Federal Democratic Republic The Federation, State and Local levels shall exercise the power of State of Nepal pursuant to this Constitution and law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Structure of State:
text: (1) The main structure of the Federal Democratic Republic There shall be States consisting of the Districts as mentioned in Schedule-4 existing in Nepal at the time of commencement of this Constitution.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Structure of State:
text: (1) The main structure of the Federal Democratic Republic There shall be Village Institutions, Municipalities and District Assemblies under the Local level. The number of Wards in a Village Institution and Municipality shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Structure of State:
text: (1) The main structure of the Federal Democratic Republic Any Special, Protected or Autonomous Region can be set by the Federal law for social, cultural protection or economic development.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Structure of State:
text: (1) The main structure of the Federal Democratic Republic The Federation, State and Local levels shall protect Nepal's freedom, sovereignty, territorial integrity, independence, national interest, overall development, multi-party, competitive, democratic, republican, federal system of governance, human rights and fundamental rights, rule of law, separation of powers and check and balance, egalitarian society based on pluralism and equality, inclusive representation and identity.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of State power:
text: (1) The powers of the Federation shall be vested in the matters enumerated in Schedule-5, and such powers shall be exercised pursuant to this Constitution and the Federal law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of State power:
text: (1) The powers of the Federation shall be vested in The powers of a State shall be vested in the matters enumerated in Schedule-6, and such powers shall be exercised pursuant to this Constitution and the State law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of State power:
text: (1) The powers of the Federation shall be vested in The concurrent powers of the Federation and the State shall be vested in the matters enumerated in Schedule-7, and such powers shall be exercised pursuant to this Constitution, the Federal law and the State law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of State power:
text: (1) The powers of the Federation shall be vested in The powers of the Local level shall be vested in the matters enumerated in Schedule-8, and such powers shall be exercised pursuant to this Constitution and the law made by the Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of State power:
text: (1) The powers of the Federation shall be vested in The concurrent powers of the Federation, State and Local levels shall be vested in the matters enumerated in Schedule-9, and such powers shall be exercised pursuant to this Constitution, the Federal law, the State law and the law made by the Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of State power:
text: (1) The powers of the Federation shall be vested in Any law to be made by the State Assembly, Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly pursuant to clause (3) or (5) shall be so made as not to be inconsistent with the Federal law, and any law made by the State Assembly, Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly which is inconsistent with the Federal law shall be invalid to the extent of such inconsistency.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of State power:
text: (1) The powers of the Federation shall be vested in Any law to be made by the Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly pursuant to clause (5) shall be so made as not to be inconsistent with the State law, and any law made by the Village Assembly or Municipal Assembly which is inconsistent with the State law shall be invalid to the extent of such inconsistency.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Residual powers: The Federation shall have power on any matter not
text: enumerated in the Federal List, State List, List of Local level or Concurrent List or on any matter which is not so specified in this Constitution as to be exercised by any level.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Exercise of financial powers:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level shall make laws, make annual budget, decisions, formulate and implement policies and plans on any matters related to financial powers within their respective jurisdictions.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Exercise of financial powers:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level shall The Federation may so make necessary policies, standards and laws on any of the matters enumerated in the Concurrent List and other areas of financial powers as to be applicable also to the States.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Exercise of financial powers:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level shall The Federation, State and Local level shall make budget of their respective levels, and the time for submission of budget by the State and Local level shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Exercise of financial powers:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level shall The Federation, State and Local level shall provide for the equitable distribution of benefits derived from the use of natural resources or development. Certain portions of such benefits shall be distributed, pursuant to law, in forms of royalty, services or goods to the project affected regions and local communities.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Exercise of financial powers:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level shall If, in utilising natural resources, the local community desires to make investment therein, the Federation, State and Local level shall accord priority to such investment in such portion as provided by law on the basis of the nature and size of such investment.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Exercise of financial powers:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level shall The Government of Nepal shall have power to obtain foreign assistance and borrow loans. Such assistance or loans shall be so obtained or borrowed as to have macro-economic stability of the country.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Exercise of financial powers:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level shall Provisions relating to the management of budget deficits and other fiscal discipline of the Federation, State and Local level shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of sources of revenue:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level may impose taxes on matters falling within their respective jurisdiction and collect revenue from these sources. Provided that provisions relating to the imposition of taxes and collection of revenue on matters that fall within the Concurrent List and on matters that are not included in the List of any level shall be as determined by the Government of Nepal.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of sources of revenue:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level The Government of Nepal shall make provisions for the equitable distribution of the collected revenue to the Federation, State and Local level.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of sources of revenue:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level The amount of fiscal transfer receivable by the State and Local level shall be as recommended by the National Natural Resources and Fiscal Commission.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of sources of revenue:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level The Government of Nepal shall, on the basis of the need of expenditure and revenue capacity, distribute fiscal equalization grants to the State and Local level.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of sources of revenue:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level Each State shall, in accordance with the State law, distribute fiscal equalization grants out of the grants received from the Government of Nepal and revenues collected from its sources, on the basis of the need of expenditure and revenue capacity of its subordinate Local level.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of sources of revenue:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level Provisions relating to distribution of conditional grants, complementary grants or special grants for other purposes to be provided by the Government of Nepal from the Federal Consolidated Fund shall be as provided for in the Federal law.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of sources of revenue:
text: (1) The Federation, State and Local level Distribution of revenues between the Federal, State and Local level shall be made in a balanced and transparent manner.
source: Federal Parliament of Nepal  Constitution of Nepal (English version)

section_title: Distribution of sources of revenue:
