text: Where the accused is unable to provide the compensation or amount pursuant to sub-section (2) in accordance with the order referred to in sub-section (1), the court shall order that the compensation or amount be provided to the victim or person dependent on him or her from the victim relief fund established pursuant to the laws in force related to the determination and execution of sentences for criminal offences, and the amount so provided shall be recovered from such accused person and reimbursed into such fund.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief
section_title: Power of court to order interim compensation
text: Where a person who has paid compensation or relief amount pursuant to this Section is acquitted of the charge by the judgment of the court, the person who has received such compensation or relief amount shall, within thirty-five days of such acquittal, return such amount to such person or to the victim relief fund referred to in sub-section (3).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Provisions Relating to Punishment and Interim Relief
section_title: Power of court to order interim compensation
text: Where such person does not return such amount within the period referred to in sub-section (4), the court shall cause such amount to be recovered from any assets of such person within thirty-five days of such acquittal.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of undermining sovereignty, integrity or national unity
text: No person shall, with the intention of undermining the independence, sovereignty, geographical or territorial integrity or national unity of Nepal, collect persons, arms and ammunitions, build any armed military or paramilitary organization or attempt to commit such act.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of undermining sovereignty, integrity or national unity
text: No person shall make, or cause to be made, any kind of conspiracy, in association with any foreign state, government or organized force, to undermine the independence, sovereignty, geographical or territorial integrity or national unity of Nepal.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of undermining sovereignty, integrity or national unity
text: No person shall abet the commission of the offence under sub-section (1) or (2).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of undermining sovereignty, integrity or national unity
text: No person shall commit, or cause to be committed, any act that gives rise to hatred, enmity or contempt on grounds of class, race, religion, region, community or similar other ground, which is likely to jeopardize the sovereignty, geographical or territorial integrity, nationality, national unity, independence, dignity, or harmonious relations between federal units, of Nepal or attempt to commit, or abet the commission of, or make conspiracy to commit, such act, or undermine or cause to be undermined the cordial relations subsisting between different castes, races or communities.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of undermining sovereignty, integrity or national unity
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in this Section shall be sentenced to the following: (a) Imprisonment for life in the case of the offence referred to in sub-section (1) or (2), (b) Imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years and a fine not exceeding one hundred thousand rupees in the case of the offence referred to in sub-section (3), (c) Imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees in the case of the offence referred to in sub-section (4).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Sedition
text: No person shall, with the intention of overthrowing the Government of Nepal or the constitutional structure, create any kind of disorder by demonstrating or using military, paramilitary or criminal force or form an armed military or paramilitary organization or make conspiracy, attempt or incitement to commit such act.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Sedition
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to punishment with imprisonment for a term not exceeding twenty-five years.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Sedition
text: No person shall, by words, either spoken or written or by figure or signs or otherwise, showing any baseless or unsubstantiated matter in relation to the Government of Nepal or any action of the Government of Nepal, bring or attempt to bring into hatred, enmity or contempt towards the Government of Nepal or cause the commission of such act. Provided that nothing contained in this sub-section shall be considered to render any healthy or decent criticism of the Government of Nepal to be the offence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Sedition
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (3) shall be liable to the sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years or a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of act against national interest
text: No one shall do, or cause to be done, any act against national interest.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of act against national interest
text: For the purposes of sub-section (1), where any person does, or causes to be done, any of the following acts, he or she shall be considered to have done an act against national interest: (a) To dishonor or degrade or spread hatred or enmity against the freedom, sovereignty, geographical or territorial integrity, nationality, independence, self-esteem of, or international image of, Nepal, (b) To encroach the international boundary of Nepal, or remove or dislocate any boundary pillar, except in accordance with agreement with a neighbouring country, or to so change any boundary pillar as to be prejudicial to the geographical or territorial integrity of Nepal.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of act against national interest
text: Any Nepali player or a group of Nepali players, who representing Nepal, plays any match in competition with any player or players in Nepal or a foreign country shall not play, or cause to be played, such match in connivance with or under the influence of any one in a manner to manipulate a natural result of such match or to make a bet win or lose, and where any match has been so played, the offence against national interest shall be considered to have been committed.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of act against national interest
text: Any person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (2) or (3) shall be liable to the following punishment: (a) A sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees, in the case of the offence referred to in sub-section (2), (b) A sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees, in the case of the offence referred to in sub-section (3).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of act against national interest
text: Where any person has transacted money in the course of the commission of the offence referred to in sub-section (2) or (3), the amount of money so transacted shall be forfeited, in addition to the punishment pursuant to sub-section (4).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of act against national interest
text: Any person who orders, directs, abets, incites or facilitates the commission of the offence referred to in sub-section (3) shall be liable to punishment as if that person were the principal offender.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of act against national interest
text: Where the offence referred to in sub-section (2) or (3) is committed by a public office holder or a person representing Nepal, while in a foreign country, he or she shall be liable to additional sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of genocide
text: No person shall commit, or cause to be committed, genocide.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of genocide
text: For the purpose of sub-section (1), any of the following acts committed with intent to destroy, in whole or in part, an ethnical, racial, national or religious group, or any attempt or conspiracy to commit such act, shall be considered to be the offence of genocide: (a) Mass killing of members of such group, in a planned way, at one or several times; (b) Causing grievous hurt to the body of, or causing serious bodily or mental harm to, members of such group, in a planned way, at one or several times; (c) Deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life, inter alia, depriving its members of access to essential goods such as water, food, fuel and medicine, by hindering the supply or movement of such goods, thereby deliberately making painful the life of members of such group, calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part; (d) Forcibly imposing measures on members of such group intended to prevent births within the group, except in cases of voluntary use by such members of family planning means; (e) Forcibly transferring children of such group to another group.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of genocide
text: Any person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to the following punishment: (a) Imprisonment for life, in the case of the offence referred to in clause (a); (b) Imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees, in addition to the sentence imposable under this Act for grievous hurt or hurt to human body, in the case of the offence referred to in clause (b); (c) Imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, in the case of the offence referred to in clause (c); (d) or (e) Imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, in the case of the offence referred to in clauses (d) or (e).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of genocide
text: Where the offence referred to in this Section is committed in pursuance of order or direction given by a person or group, whether organized or unorganized, the person, or the responsible person or persons of such group giving such order or direction shall be liable as the principal offender.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of genocide
text: Where the offence referred to in this Section has been committed by a group or with the involvement of several persons, every person involved in such offence shall be equally liable as the offender.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of genocide
text: Where any person who commits the offence referred to in this Section is a public office holder, he or she shall not be allowed to make a plea that such offence has been committed in the course of executing a superior order or maintaining law and order or enforcing law, and that person shall not enjoy any remission or waiver from sentence on the ground that he or she has made such plea.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of waging war against Nepal or assisting enemy
text: No person shall wage or declare to wage war against Nepal, by raising arms, or attempt or threaten to wage such war, or collect arms, ammunition or form a military or paramilitary organization with intent to wage war against Nepal.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of waging war against Nepal or assisting enemy
text: No person shall, in any situation whether a state of war is declared or not, supply any kind of strategic or military information or otherwise render assistance to any foreign army engaged in war with Nepal or attempt to do so.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of waging war against Nepal or assisting enemy
text: Where a declaration is made by the Government of Nepal prohibiting the making of relations or transactions with a State engaged in war with Nepal, any citizen or corporate body of such State or the importing or obtaining of any goods or services of such State, no person shall make such relation or transaction with such State, citizen or body or import or obtain such goods or services.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of waging war against Nepal or assisting enemy
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) or (2) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for life, and a person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (3) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding twenty-five years and a fine not exceeding one hundred thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of waging war or insurrection against friendly State
text: No person shall, using the territory of Nepal, wage or threaten to wage war, by raising arms, or attempt to wage such war or insurrect or attempt to insurrect against a State having diplomatic relations with Nepal.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of waging war or insurrection against friendly State
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding seven years and a fine not exceeding seventy thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of giving provocation to army or police
text: No person shall abet or give provocation to the desertion of a soldier, police or armed police personnel or officer in the Nepal Army, Nepal Police or Armed Police Force, Nepal from the Nepal Army, Nepal Police or Armed Police Force, Nepal or abet the breach of discipline by such soldier, police or armed police personnel or attempt to seduce such soldier, police or armed police personnel from his or her duty, or, knowing or having reason to believe that a soldier, police or armed police personnel has so deserted the Army or Police or Force, harbor such deserter.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of giving provocation to army or police
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years and a fine not exceeding one hundred thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of espionage
text: No person shall, with intent to undermine the sovereignty, security or geographical or territorial integrity of Nepal or to prejudice the interests of Nepal or with the knowledge that such consequence is likely, or being induced by any foreign country or international organization, supply to any one any information relating to the military situation, strategic arrangement or internal security of Nepal or relating to any matter that must be kept confidential by the Government of Nepal from the political, economic or diplomatic viewpoint or confidential document, or any matter that is confidential or must be kept confidential under law or conspire or attempt to commit, or abet the commission of, such act or do any other act with intent to supply such information, and a person who commits such act shall be considered to have committed espionage.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of espionage
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, espionage referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to punishment as follows: (a) In the case of espionage related to any matter of military situation, strategic arrangement or internal security of Nepal, imprisonment for a term not exceeding twenty-five years; (b) In the case of espionage related to any matter that must be kept confidential by the Government of Nepal from the political, economic or diplomatic viewpoint or any other confidential document, imprisonment for a term ranging from five to ten years; (c) In the case of espionage related to any matter other than clauses (a) and (b), imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine of fifty thousand rupees; (d) In the case of a person, despite knowing that anyone is going to commit espionage, who does not give information to the Government of Nepal, imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine of one hundred thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of assault on President
text: No person shall assassinate or attempt to assassinate the President of Nepal.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of assault on President
text: No person shall, in any manner, abduct, or cause to be abducted, the President of Nepal or take, or cause to be taken, him or her hostage.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of assault on President
text: No person shall, in any manner, assault, or cause to be assaulted, the President of Nepal.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of assault on President
text: A person who commits any offence referred to in this Section shall be liable to punishment as follows: (a) Imprisonment for life, in the case of subsection (1); (b) Imprisonment for a term ranging from ten to fifteen years, in the case of subsection (2); (c) Imprisonment for a term ranging from five to ten years, in the case of subsection (3).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of intimidation of President or Parliament
text: No person shall intimidate, whether by using any kind of force or not, show fear or terror to, or otherwise overawe the President or Parliament of Nepal with intent to prevent or restrain the President or Parliament of Nepal from performing any of the functions required to be performed pursuant to the Constitution or law or compel the President or Parliament of Nepal to perform the functions in any specific manner.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Prohibition of intimidation of President or Parliament
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding seven years or a fine not exceeding seventy thousand rupees or with both. Explanation: For the purposes of this Section, the term 'Parliament' means the Federal Parliament and the State Assembly under the Constitution of Nepal, and this term also includes the Legislature-Parliament.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Statute of limitation
text: No statute of limitation shall apply to a complaint with regard to any of the offences under Sections 49, 50, 51, 52, 53 and 57.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against the State
section_title: Statute of limitation
text: In the case of the offences under the Sections of this Chapter, except those Sections set forth in sub-section (1), no complaint shall be entertained after the expiry of two years of the date of knowledge of the commission of the offence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of unlawful assembly
text: No person shall be engaged in an unlawful assembly.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of unlawful assembly
text: An assembly of five or more persons with the objective of doing any of the following acts shall be considered to be an unlawful assembly: (a) By means of force, show of force, or show of a deadly weapon, to (1) prevent any public servant from exercising lawful functions or duties, (2) take or obtain possession of anyones property, (3) deprive any person of the enjoyment of the right of way, use of water, public transport, communication, or similar utilities, (4) compel any person to do what he or she is not legally bound to do or to omit what he or she is legally entitled to do; (b) To hinder or resist the execution of any law or legal process; (c) To commit any offence punishable by imprisonment.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of unlawful assembly
text: Any person who, with the knowledge that it is an unlawful assembly, joins the assembly shall be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months and a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees where unarmed, and imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees where armed.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of unlawful assembly
text: Any person who does not join an unlawful assembly but hires, induces, or overawes another to join such assembly shall be liable to the sentence referred to in sub-section (3) as if he or she had joined.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of breach of order issued to prevent or disperse unlawful assembly
text: Where a competent authority makes an order to prevent or disperse an unlawful assembly, no person shall participate or continue in such assembly.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of breach of order issued to prevent or disperse unlawful assembly
text: A person who continues in, participates in, or joins an unlawful assembly under sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Every member to be considered to have committed offence
text: Where any member of an unlawful assembly commits any offence in achievement of the object of such assembly, every member who aids and assists knowingly at the time of commission of offence shall be considered to have committed the offence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of rioting
text: No person shall commit, or cause to be committed, the offence of rioting.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of rioting
text: Where an unlawful assembly or a member thereof uses force or destroys, damages or causes loss to any public or private property in the course of achievement of the object of such assembly, every member shall be considered to have committed the offence of rioting.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of rioting
text: Every person who commits the offense referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees if armed with a deadly weapon, and imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees if not armed.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of abetting rioting
text: No person shall, with intent to cause the commission of rioting or with the knowledge that rioting is likely, abet the commission of rioting by another person.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of abetting rioting
text: A person who abets under sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year if the offence of rioting is committed, and to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months if the offence is not committed, or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility
text: No person, by words, spoken or written, by signs or otherwise, shall do any act which, on the ground of religion, color, caste, race, community, or language, is prejudicial to harmonious relationship between peoples of different classes, regions, or communities of Nepal.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of acts prejudicial to public tranquility
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) in any shrine, place of worship, or assembly engaged in a religious or cultural festival shall be liable to an additional sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year, in addition to the sentence in sub-section (2).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing public servant
text: No person shall obstruct or attempt to obstruct any public official in the discharge of duty to prevent or disperse an unlawful assembly or suppress a riot.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing public servant
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing movement in public place
text: No person, by show of fear or terror, shall close or obstruct a public road, way, rope-way, cable-car, airport, railway, water route, or impede the movement of pedestrians, vehicles, or animals except in accordance with a competent authority's order.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing movement in public place
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding three years or a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing public services
text: No person shall, by show of fear or threat, close or obstruct the operation of public electricity, telecommunication, or other public services.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing public services
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding three years or a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of violating curfew
text: No person shall knowingly violate a curfew order imposed by a competent authority under law to prevent unlawful assembly, riot, or any act breaching public tranquility.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of violating curfew
text: A person who commits the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Not to spread rumor
text: No person shall, with intent to breach public tranquility, commit rioting, undermine sovereignty, or harm communal harmony, spread rumors or hold a procession with provocative slogans.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Not to spread rumor
text: Any person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of providing house, land, or vehicle for breaching peace
text: No person, knowing or having reason to know that another is going to breach public peace or commit rioting, shall provide house, land, vehicle, or arm to that person.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of providing house, land, or vehicle for breaching peace
text: Any person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of holding torch procession in sensitive public area
text: No person shall, with intent to breach public peace, hold any torch procession, assembly, or procession carrying fire or inflammable substances in a sensitive public area designated by competent authority.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of holding torch procession in sensitive public area
text: A person who commits the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities
text: No person shall, having committed any offence under this Chapter, destroy, damage, set on fire, disorder, steal, knowingly buy or sell, or cause others to commit such acts on essential commodities or property.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities
text: A person who commits the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to an additional imprisonment not exceeding one year or fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both, in addition to any other sentence under this Chapter.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities
text: Where such commodity or property has already been destroyed or damaged, compensation equal to the claimed amount shall be recovered from such person.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Prohibition of destroying or damaging essential commodities
text: Where the offender is identified, such person, or if not identified, the person who induces or orders the act, shall be considered to have committed the offence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Tranquility
section_title: Statute of limitation
text: No complaint on an offence under this Chapter shall lie after the lapse of three months from the date of commission of such offence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing the service of summons, process etc.
text: No person shall obstruct in or object to, or cause to be done so, the service of a summons, process, arrest warrant, notice or order issued under a law or the making of search, seizure, survey, measurement or public inquiry or arresting any person in pursuance of a warrant.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing the service of summons, process etc.
text: A person who commits the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing the service of summons, process etc.
text: Where a public servant commits the offence in sub-section (1), he or she shall be liable to an additional imprisonment not exceeding three months.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

section_title: Prohibition of refusing to receive and returning summons, process, notice or order
text: Where a person in whose name a summons, process, notice, arrest warrant or order has been issued under law is tendered for service, such person shall, with mala fide intention, not refuse to receive or return it.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

section_title: Prohibition of refusing to receive and returning summons, process, notice or order
text: A person who commits the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding three months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

section_title: Prohibition of absconding to avoid service of summons, process, notice or order
text: No person, legally bound to receive a summons, process, notice, arrest warrant or order, shall abscond with mala fide intention to avoid service.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

section_title: Prohibition of absconding to avoid service of summons, process, notice or order
text: A person who commits the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding three months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

section_title: Prohibition of tearing out or removing summons, process etc.
text: No person shall, with mala fide intention, tear out or remove a summons, process, arrest warrant, notice or order affixed in accordance with law until its purpose is served.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

section_title: Prohibition of tearing out or removing summons, process etc.
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence in sub-section (1) shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of serving process in a false manner
text: No person who is legally bound to serve, or cause to be served, a process shall serve the process in a false manner.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of serving process in a false manner
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of omission to produce document
text: No person who is legally bound to produce or deliver up any document to any office, court or public servant under law shall omit so to produce or deliver up such document.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of omission to produce document
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making false statement by person under oath
text: A person who is bound by law or by an oath to state the truth on any subject to any competent authority or is a public office holder upon taking oath under law shall not, in that capacity, state any false statement.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making false statement by person under oath
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years or a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of refusing oath
text: No person who is present before the competent authority to state the truth on any subject shall refuse to take an oath to state the truth on such subject when so required to take such oath.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of refusing oath
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of refusing to answer
text: No person who is under a legal duty to state the truth on any subject to a competent authority shall refuse to answer any question demanded of him or her on such subject by such authority. Provided that no person shall be compelled to testify against himself or herself.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of refusing to answer
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of giving false information
text: No person shall give any false information to any one, with intent to prevent any public servant from doing any act which he or she is bound by law to do or to cause such public servant to do anything which he or she need not or ought not to do.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of giving false information
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing
text: No person shall, by way of intimidation or force or in any other way, obstruct or hinder any public servant, who is discharging his or her public duties, in the discharge of such duties.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing
text: No person shall knowingly obstruct or hinder the process of forfeiture, collection of records, withholding, auction or sale of any property being carried out in accordance with law.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) or (2) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of refusing to render assistance to public servant
text: No person under a legal duty to render assistance to a public servant in the execution of his or her public duty shall refuse to so render such assistance.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of refusing to render assistance to public servant
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of disobedience to order
text: No person shall disobey an order made by a competent authority in accordance with law, by omitting to do anything ought to be done under law or doing anything prohibited by law.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of disobedience to order
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Statute of limitation
text: No complaint shall lie after the lapse of three months from the date of knowledge of the commission of any offence under Section 78, 80 or 83 and from the date of the commission of any offence under the other Sections of this Chapter.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of fabricating evidence
text: Except as otherwise provided in this Act, no person shall fabricate evidence, cause any circumstance to exist, forge any document or electronic record or make any false entry in any document or electronic record, with intent to use it in a judicial or other legal proceeding.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of fabricating evidence
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees. Provided that where a sentence of imprisonment for life has been imposed on any person on the basis of such false evidence, the offender shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding seven years and a fine not exceeding seventy thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of fabricating evidence
text: Notwithstanding anything contained elsewhere in this Section, no sentence shall be so imposed under this Section that the sentence is in excess of the maximum sentence that can be imposed on the offence in relation to which the evidence has been fabricated.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making or issuing false certificate
text: No person with authority or duty under law to submit, certify, authenticate or issue a certificate or submit an affidavit in relation to any matter shall submit, certify, authenticate or issue such certificate or submit such affidavit, knowingly setting down a false statement in such certificate or affidavit.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making or issuing false certificate
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of using false evidence or certificate
text: No person shall, knowing that any evidence or certificate is false, use, or cause to be used, as true such false evidence or certificate.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of using false evidence or certificate
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of destroying document
text: No person who is under a legal duty to produce any document or electronic record as evidence in a judicial or other legal proceeding shall knowingly destroy, obliterate, render illegible such document or record, or otherwise make it incapable of being used as evidence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of destroying document
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of destroying document
text: No person shall, in contravention of law, knowingly destroy, obliterate, render illegible any document or electronic record produced in any judicial or other legal proceeding or otherwise making such document or record incapable of being used as evidence or cause it to disappear illegally or give it to another person in an unauthorized manner.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of destroying document
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (3) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding four years and a fine not exceeding forty thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of destroying document
text: If a public servant commits the offence referred to in sub-section (1) or (3), he or she shall be liable to double the sentence referred to in that sub-section.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of concealing evidence of offence
text: No person shall, with intent to protect any offender, conceal or destroy any evidence relating to the offense committed by the offender or render it ineligible to be used as evidence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of concealing evidence of offence
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing the giving of information
text: No person shall restraint or otherwise obstruct or hinder a person who, upon knowing that an offence has been committed or is about to be committed, intends to give information or notice about such offence to the police or competent authority.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing the giving of information
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years or a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of harboring offender
text: No person shall knowingly harbor an offender with intent to prevent him or her from being apprehended or save him or her from a lawful sentence. Explanation: For the purposes of this Section, the term 'offender' means a person who is suspected or accused of an offence or convicted by a court of such offence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of harboring offender
text: Sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees where that person has harbored the offender of an offence punishable by imprisonment for life or imprisonment for a term not exceeding twenty years.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of harboring offender
text: Sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees where that person has harbored the offender of an offence punishable by imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of harboring offender
text: Sentence of imprisonment or fine not exceeding one fourth of the maximum term of imprisonment or amount of fine or both the sentences imposable for the offence where that person has harbored the offender of the offence other than that mentioned in clause (a) or (b).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of harboring offender
text: Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), no offence referred to in this Section shall be considered to have been committed where the offender's husband or wife or father, mother, son, daughter, elder brother, younger brother, elder sister, younger sister, grand-father, grand-mother, grand-son, grand-daughter, mother-in-law, father-in-law, daughter-in-law or son-in-law has harbored the offender.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Obligation to give information of commission of offence
text: No person under a legal duty to give information regarding any offence shall, knowing that such offence has been or is going to be committed, omit to give information of such offence or no person who knows the commission of any offence shall intentionally give false information about that offence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Obligation to give information of commission of offence
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years or a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of concealment of property or fraudulent claim to property
text: No person shall fraudulently conceal, transfer or deliver to any person, or cause to be concealed, transferred or delivered, any property, or right in such property, which is liable to be forfeited, withheld, auctioned, sold or enforced or inventory of which is to be taken pursuant to a decision of a court or competent authority, intending thereby to prevent that property or right from being so forfeited, withheld, auctioned, sold or enforced or make a claim to such property or right therein.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of concealment of property or fraudulent claim to property
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years or a fine not exceeding twenty thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making false complaint
text: No person shall, with intent to injure or annoy any person, make a false claim or accusation or give false information against such person before or to an authority making judicial proceeding.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making false complaint
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to half the maximum sentence imposable for the offence in respect of which such false accusation has been made. Provided that this Section shall not apply to any case in which the Government of Nepal is plaintiff.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making false complaint
text: Where the offence referred to in sub-section (1) has resulted in any kind of harm or loss to a person who is a victim of such offence, compensation for such harm or loss shall be recovered from the offender to the victim.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making investigation or prosecution maliciously
text: No authority responsible by law for making investigation or prosecution shall make investigation or prosecution maliciously, with intent to have an innocent person bear liability or to save the real offender.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making investigation or prosecution maliciously
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding five thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences against Public Justice
section_title: Prohibition of making investigation or prosecution maliciously
text: Where any person suffers any kind of harm or loss from the offence referred to in sub-section (1), he or she shall be entitled to get compensation from such offender.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of failure to appear in violation of terms and conditions of guarantee:
text: (1) No person who has been charged with an offence and released on guarantee shall fail, without a reasonable cause, to appear in the office or court to which guarantee is given in accordance with the terms and conditions of such guarantee. Explanation: For the purpose of this Section, guarantee means cash, bank guarantee or personal guarantee.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of failure to appear in violation of terms and conditions of guarantee:
text: A person who commits the offence referred to in subsection (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding ten thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of failure to appear in violation of terms and conditions of guarantee:
text: Where a person who fails to so appear under this Section is convicted of the offence with which he or she has been charged shall be liable to the additional sentence under this Section, in addition to the sentence imposable on him or her for such offence.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of failure to appear in violation of terms and conditions of guarantee:
text: Where a person who is released on personal guarantee in accordance with law fails to appear in the office or court in accordance with such guarantee, the person giving such guarantee shall be liable to a sentence of fine not exceeding fifty thousand rupees.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of failure to appear in violation of terms and conditions of guarantee:
text: A person who has been sentenced under this Section shall not be eligible to become a surety without security until three years.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing apprehension or escaping from custody:
text: (1) No person for whose apprehension an arrest warrant has been issued shall knowingly make any obstruction, by using force, in the course of apprehension or to the apprehension of himself or herself or to escape from apprehension if already apprehended or no person who is lawfully detained in custody shall escape or attempt to escape from such custody.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing apprehension or escaping from custody:
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years or a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing apprehension or rescuing from custody:
text: (1) No person shall intentionally make obstruction in the course of apprehension of or to the apprehension of any other person for whose apprehension an arrest warrant has been issued in accordance with law or rescue such other person from apprehension if already apprehended or intentionally escape or aid in the escape of a person who is lawfully detained in custody from such custody.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing apprehension or rescuing from custody:
text: A person who commits, or causes to be committed, the offence referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to a sentence of imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years or a fine not exceeding thirty thousand rupees or both the sentences.
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Prohibition of obstructing apprehension or rescuing from custody:
text: If any public servant commits or causes to be committed the offence referred to in sub-section (1), he or she shall be liable to double the sentence specified in sub-section (2).
source: National Penal (Code) Act, 2017 (English translation)  https://bwcimplementation.org/sites/default/files/resource/NP_National%20Penal%20Code%20Act_EN.pdf

chapter_title: Offences Relating to Contempt of Authority of Public Servants
section_title: Statute of limitation:
